clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiovascular Risk Evaluation in Psoriasis Treated With Photochemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Photochemotherapy on Cardiometabolic Markers in Patients With Psoriasis With and Without Atherosclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: Ultraviolet (UV) phototherapy is a standard treatment for many inflammatory dermatological diseases, including psoriasis. The systemic effects of UV phototherapy are still not well studied. There are several factors that may affect patient's cardiovascular (CV) risk during UV phototherapy. Atherosclerosis is now known to have an inflammatory origin and to be frequently associated with psoriasis. In this study the investigators aim at studying the effect of psoralen-UVA phototherapy on several biomarkers of CV risk in patients with psoriasis with or without atherosclerosis.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparative change in photoinduced oxidation and related change in cardiovascular risk between both risk groups in response to photochemotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: day 0 to end of 12 weeks (end of 36 sessions, 3 sessions weekly of photochemotherapy) and/or clinical cure whichever comes first
primary_outcome.description: Comparison between both risk groups in the amount of change between baseline level and end of study level of oxidized low density lipoprotein

secondary_outcome.measure: comparative number of patients with metabolic syndrome after therapy in both groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of 12 weeks (end of 36 sessions, 3 sessions weekly of photochemotherapy) and/or clinical cure whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison between both risk groups as regards the number of patients with metabolic syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative changes in metabolic syndrome component 1: waist circumference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 0 to end of 12 weeks (end of 36 sessions, 3 sessions weekly of photochemotherapy) and/or clinical cure whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison between both risk groups in the amount of change between baseline level and EOS level of waist circumference

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative changes in metabolic syndrome component 2: arterial blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 0 to end of 12 weeks (end of 36 sessions, 3 sessions weekly of photochemotherapy) and/or clinical cure whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison between both risk groups in the amount of change between baseline level and EOS level of arterial blood pressure

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative changes in metabolic syndrome component 3: blood sugar
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 0 to end of 12 weeks (end of 36 sessions, 3 sessions weekly of photochemotherapy) and/or clinical cure whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison between both risk groups in the amount of change between baseline level and EOS level of blood sugar

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative changes in metabolic syndrome component 4: serum lipids
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 0 to end of 12 weeks (end of 36 sessions, 3 sessions weekly of photochemotherapy) and/or clinical cure whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison between both risk groups in the amount of change between baseline level and EOS level of serum lipids

secondary_outcome.measure: Atherosclerotic changes in the high risk group in response to PUVA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of 12 weeks (end of 36 sessions, 3 sessions weekly of photochemotherapy)
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of duplex arteriography findings in the high risk group between before and after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between cutaneous response and systemic response to photochemotherapy in both risk groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 0 to end of 12 weeks (end of 36 sessions, 3 sessions weekly of photochemotherapy) and/or clinical cure whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between PASI score after treatment and other parameters of systemic response (hs-CRP, ox-LDL, metabolic syndrome components)

arm_group.description: Patients with psoriasis and atherosclerosis will receive PUVA therapy for 36 sessions divided as 3 sessions weekly
Patients with psoriasis but no atherosclerosis detected, will receive PUVA therapy for 36 sessions divided as 3 sessions weekly
Age-matching apparently normal individuals will receive no interventions but will perform investigational tests.

intervention.description: 36 sessions of psoralen-ultraviolet A, divided as 3 sessions weekly

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Disease affecting > 10% body surface area
- Patient willing to commit to 3 sessions weekly for 3-6 months without interruption
Exclusion Criteria:
- Disease severity less than 10% body surface area
- Patients unable to commit for therapeutic schedule due to work or residence issues.
- pregnant and lactating females
- photosensitive dermatoses
